016package de.cuioss.test.jsf.renderer.util;
017
018import lombok.experimental.UtilityClass;
019import org.jdom2.Attribute;
020import org.jdom2.Document;
021import org.jdom2.Element;
022
023import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.*;
024
025/**
026 * Provides asserts for {@link Document} and Jdom elements.
027 *
028 * @author Oliver Wolff
029 */
030@UtilityClass
031public final class HtmlTreeAsserts {
032
033    private static final String THE_VALUES_ARE_NOT_EQUAL_EXPECTED = "%s: The values for attribute '%s' are not equal, expected=%s, actual=%s";
034
035    private static final String ACTUAL_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL = "Actual must not be null";
036
037    private static final String EXPECTED_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL = "Expected must not be null";
038
039    private static final AttributeComparator ATTRIBUTE_COMPARATOR = new AttributeComparator();
040
041    /**
042     * Compares two instances of {@link Document} for equality. Attribute order is
043     * not relevant, but element order is.
044     *
045     * @param expected expected value
046     * @param actual   the value to check against <code>expected</code>
047     */
048    public static void assertHtmlTreeEquals(final Document expected, final Document actual) {
049        assertNotNull(expected, EXPECTED_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
050        assertNotNull(actual, ACTUAL_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
051        var expectedNode = expected.getRootElement();
052        var actualNode = actual.getRootElement();
053        assertElementWithChildrenEquals(expectedNode, actualNode, "");
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Compares two instances of {@link Element} for equality. Attribute order is
058     * not relevant.It checks the children recursively as well.
059     *
060     * @param expected expected value
061     * @param actual   the value to check against <code>expected</code>
062     * @param pointer  String based path identifier
063     */
064    public static void assertElementWithChildrenEquals(final Element expected, final Element actual,
065                                                       final String pointer) {
066        var currentPointer = pointer + ">" + expected.getName();
067        assertElementEquals(expected, actual, currentPointer);
068        var expectedChildren = expected.getChildren();
069        var actualChildren = actual.getChildren();
070        if (null != expected.getAttribute("id")) {
071            currentPointer = currentPointer + "[" + expected.getAttribute("id").getValue() + "]";
072        }
073        var expectedTextChild = expected.getTextNormalize();
074        var actualTextChild = actual.getTextNormalize();
075        assertEquals(expectedTextChild, actualTextChild,
076            "%s: The text content of the elements are not equal, expected=%s, actual=%s".formatted(currentPointer,
077                expectedTextChild, actualTextChild));
078        if (expectedChildren.isEmpty() && actualChildren.isEmpty()) {
079            return;
080        }
081        if (expectedChildren.size() != actualChildren.size()) {
082            fail("%s: The number of children is not equal, expected=%s, actual=%s".formatted(currentPointer,
083                expectedChildren, actualChildren));
084        }
085        for (var i = 0; i < expectedChildren.size(); i++) {
086            assertElementWithChildrenEquals(expectedChildren.get(i), actualChildren.get(i), currentPointer);
087        }
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Compares two instances of {@link Element} for equality. Attribute order is
092     * not relevant. It checks the name of the elements and the attributes,
093     * <em>not</em> the children
094     *
095     * @param expected expected value
096     * @param actual   actual the value to check against <code>expected</code>
097     * @param pointer  String based path identifier
098     */
099    public static void assertElementEquals(final Element expected, final Element actual, final String pointer) {
100        assertNotNull(expected, EXPECTED_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
101        assertNotNull(actual, ACTUAL_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
102        assertEquals(expected.getName(), actual.getName(),
103            "%s: The names are not equal, expected=%s, actual=%s".formatted(pointer, expected, actual));
104        var expectedAttributes = expected.getAttributes();
105        var actualAttributes = actual.getAttributes();
106        if (expectedAttributes.isEmpty() && actualAttributes.isEmpty()) {
107            return;
108        }
109        expectedAttributes.sort(ATTRIBUTE_COMPARATOR);
110        actualAttributes.sort(ATTRIBUTE_COMPARATOR);
111        if (expectedAttributes.size() != actualAttributes.size()) {
112            fail("%s: The number of the attributes are not equal, expected=%s, actual=%s".formatted(pointer,
113                expectedAttributes, actualAttributes));
114        }
115        for (var i = 0; i < expectedAttributes.size(); i++) {
116            assertAttributeEquals(expectedAttributes.get(i), actualAttributes.get(i), pointer);
117        }
118    }
119
120    /**
121     * Compares two instances of {@link Attribute} for equality.
122     *
123     * @param expected expected value
124     * @param actual   the value to check against <code>expected</code>
125     * @param pointer  String based path identifier
126     */
127    public static void assertAttributeEquals(final Attribute expected, final Attribute actual, final String pointer) {
128        assertNotNull(expected, EXPECTED_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
129        assertNotNull(actual, ACTUAL_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
130        assertEquals(expected.getName(), actual.getName(),
131            "%s: The name of the attributes are not equal, expected=%s, actual=%s".formatted(pointer, expected,
132                actual));
133        assertEquals(expected.getValue(), actual.getValue(), THE_VALUES_ARE_NOT_EQUAL_EXPECTED.formatted(pointer,
134            expected.getName(), expected.getValue(), actual.getValue()));
135    }
136}
